description.narrative: ACJPD is a non-profit youth organization, founded in June 2006, with headquarters in the Mumahi-Pista Velha District, Alto Molócuè District. in Zambeze province. Initially, the aim was to establish within the Youth a culture of peace, tolerance, love your neighbor, as well as providing a set of experiences that would allow them to deepen and increase the knowledge of their tastes and useful skills for a demanding future . ACJPD formalizes its statutes in the Boletim da República through SERIE III - Number 88 of November 4, 2013, gaining legal personality as a provincial-level youth association. In its actions the ACJPD intervenes in the areas of education, governance, health, prioritizing in its projects the interaction and capacity building of various actors of society at local level. It is an innovative association, aware about context challenges of youth, searching for the better ways to combat poverty and the causes of problem that affected the youth. On this basis, it intends to be an association capable of contributing to the sustainable socioeconomic development of the country. The ACJPD and its partners work to ensure that human rights are recognized, respected and protected within the legal framework and democracy. The ACJPD Vision consist in a society of peace, free from poverty andsocial injustice, where young people enjoy their individual and collective rights of participation, free expression, access to employment and resources. The organization's mission's is to challenge the causes of poverty and social injustice by supporting actions and practices that will improve the living conditions of young people and respect for human rights in the communities of the Alto Molocué District.

participating-org.narrative: ACJPD is a non-profit youth organization founded in June 2006, with headquarters in the Mumahi-Pista Velha District, Alto Molócuè District in Zambézia Province. ACJPD formalizes its statutes in Republic Bulletin through SERIE III - Number 88 of November4, 2013, and has gained legal personality as a youth organization in provincial level. In terms of typology, ACJPD is a membership or rights-holders based organization, works on Education and health area, governance, prioritizing his projects the interaction and capacity building of various actors on society with focus on local level. Is an innovative Organization, that is aware of the challenges, and looking for to the better ways to fight against the poverty mainly at the youth level. Other hand this Organization intends to be an association capable to contribute for the sustainable socio-economic development of the country. The organization's missionto challenge the causes of poverty and social injustice by supporting actions and practices that will improve the living conditionsof young people and to respect for human rights in the communities of the Alto Molocué District. The ACJPD#s vision is a society inpeace, free from poverty and social injustice, where young people enjoy their individual and collective rights of participation, free expression, access to employment and resources. The overall strategic objective is: Through strategic and systematic actions, aims to fulfil its responsibilities on promoting of human rights, gender equity and equality, access to information for young people, as well as directly intervening on empowering of communities, on changing attitudes and behaviours of the young people of today, who will be the adults of tomorrow. This partner will have contributed to AICE on cross-cutting issues on youth component.
